config.editor.sourceFormat.description: The default source format that should be applied to the document
config.editor.dialect.description: The default dialect that should be used when colorizing the document
config.editor.improvedTabStops.descripti: Overrides the TAB behaviour for COBOL to use tab stops that are applicable to the current source format.
config.editor.customTabStops.description: Sets custom tab stops for COBOL.
config.editor.smartEdit.description: Some edit operations such as indent will be restricted to area A and area B.
config.installLocation.description: The root folder of the COBOL product to be used by the extension
config.suppressBuildAssetsPrompt.descrip: Suppress the prompt to add missing assets required for build or debug
config.MSBuild.resolve.description: Specify how to resolve the location of MSBuild when compiling Visual Studio projects.
config.MSBuild.resolve.current.descripti: Uses the current process environment. You must add the MSBuild location to the PATH before starting Visual Studio Code.
config.MSBuild.resolve.auto.description: Locate and set the MSBuild location automatically. Uses the first MSBuild installation found.
config.MSBuild.resolve.user.description: Use the location specified in microFocusCOBOL.MSBuild.path.
config.MSBuild.path.description: Specify the path to the MSBuild executable.
config.ant.ant_homeResolve.description: Specify how to resolve the location of Ant when compiling Eclipse projects.
config.ant.ant_homeResolve.current.descr: Uses the current process environment. You must have Ant on the PATH and have set ANT_HOME before starting Visual Studio Code.
config.ant.ant_homeResolve.user.descript: Use the location specified in microFocusCOBOL.ant.ant_homePath.
config.ant.ant_homePath.description: Specify the path to the install folder of Ant.
config.ant.java_homeResolve.description: Specify how to resolve the location of Java when compiling Eclipse projects.
config.ant.java_homeResolve.current.desc: Uses the current process environment. You must have Java on the PATH and have set JAVA_HOME before starting Visual Studio Code.
config.ant.java_homeResolve.user.descrip: Use the location specified in microFocusCOBOL.ant.java_homePath.
config.ant.java_homePath.description: Specify the path to the install folder of Java.
config.suppressFileAssociationsPrompt.de: Suppress warning when conflicting file associations have been defined.
config.CTF.configurationFile.description: Consolidated Tracing Facility (CTF) configuration file to be used when launching the debugger or build tasks.
Select logging verbosity of communication between vscode and the language server.
config.languageServerAutostart.descripti: Configures Micro Focus COBOL Language Server to automatically start upon detection of COBOL files in the workspace.
config.terminal.32bit.description: Set the terminal to use 32-bit programs.
config.defaultDirectives.description: Directives to be used by the Debug/Run COBOL Program menu items and the COBOL language server (requires 8.0 patch update 1 or later).
config.microFocusDirectivesFile.trace.se: Select logging verbosity of communication between vscode and the language server.
semanticTokenTypes.cobol-period.descript: COBOL Period (full stop), when it appears to lexically be a full stop
tasks.args.quoting.description: How the argument should be quoted
tasks.args.quoting.escape.description: Escapes characters using the shell's escape character (e.g ` under PowerShell and \ under bash)
tasks.args.quoting.strong.description: Quotes the argument using the shell's strong quote character (e.g. ' under PowerShell and bash)
tasks.args.quoting.weak.description: Quotes the argument using the shell's weak quote character (e.g. " under PowerShell and bash)
tasks.msbuild.args.description: Any additional arguments that should be passed to msbuild
tasks.msbuild.buildTarget.description: The msbuild target that should be invoked
tasks.ant.mfAntLib.description: Location of the Micro Focus COBOL ant library
tasks.ant.buildTarget.description: The ant target that should be invoked
tasks.ant.args.description: Any additional arguments that should be passed to ant
tasks.shell.command.description: The command to be executed. Can be an external program or a shell command
tasks.shell.command.args.description: Arguments passed to the command when this task is invoked
tasks.shell.command.windows.is64Bit.desc: When on Windows, use the 64 bit COBOL compiler
tasks.shell.command.windows.command.desc: The command to be executed when run on Windows. Can be an external program or a shell command
tasks.shell.command.windows.args.descrip: Arguments passed to the command on a Windows platform, when this task is invoked
tasks.shell.command.quoting.description: How the command should be quoted
tasks.shell.command.quoting.escape.descr: Escapes characters using the shell's escape character (e.g ` under PowerShell and \ under bash)
tasks.shell.command.quoting.strong.descr: Quotes the argument using the shell's strong quote character (e.g. ' under PowerShell and bash)
tasks.shell.command.quoting.weak.descrip: Quotes the argument using the shell's weak quote character (e.g. ' under PowerShell and bash)
tasks.shell.command.linux.command.descri: The command to be executed when run on Linux. Can be an external program or a shell command
tasks.shell.command.linux.is64Bit.descri: When on Linux, use the 64 bit COBOL compiler
tasks.mfprocess.args.description: Arguments passed to the command when this task is run
debug.cobol.native.properties.program.de:
Path to the executable to launch.
Example: '${workspaceFolder}/Application.exe'
debug.cobol.native.properties.trace.desc: Enable logging of the Debug Adapter Protocol.
debug.cobol.native.properties.cwd.descri: Path to the working directory of the program being debugged.
debug.cobol.native.properties.args.array: Command line arguments passed to the program.
debug.cobol.native.properties.args.strin: Stringified version of command line arguments passed to the program.
debug.cobol.native.properties.symbolSear: Paths to search for program symbol (.idy) files.
debug.cobol.native.properties.env.descri: Environment variables passed to the program.
debug.cobol.native.properties.envFile.de: Absolute path to a file containing environment variable definitions. This file has key value pairs separated by an equals sign per line. E.g. KEY=VALUE.
debug.cobol.native.properties.es.propert: Server name.
The debug listener address for the server to be debugged.
The type of application to debug.
Optional parameters for the launch.
JCL options.
The name of the job.
The number of the job in the held queue.
The step that you want to debug.
The start program to be used when debugging this application.
CICS options.
The CICS user id used to start the application.
The CICS terminal id used to start the application.
The CICS transaction for the application.
The CICS invoked program at which to start debugging.
IMS options.
The user id to be used when debugging this application.
The logical terminal ID to be used when debugging this application.
The transaction to be used when debugging this application.
The start program to be used when debugging this application.
Web Services options.
Leave this field empty to enable debugging from any IP address. Specify an IP address to allow debugging only from it.
Specify the address of the web service to debug. Enter the address and any specific operation that is part of the web service in the following format - http://namespace/ServiceName#OperationName.
debug.cobol.native.properties.stepOverIg: Step into inline PERFORM statements when using Step Over.
debug.cobol.native.properties.programBre: Program breakpoint on main entry point only.
debug.cobol.native.properties.remoteDebu: When present, this tells the debugger to connect to a remote computer.
The remote machine name or IP address.
The port number that is used by the cobdebugremote or cobdebugremote64 process.
debug.cobol.native.properties.waitForAtt: The debugger waits for the program to start in a separate process before attempting to attach to it.
Waits for and then attaches to the next COBOL program that is launched with its working directory set to either the folder specified, or a subfolder of it.
Return the debugger to a waiting state when the program being debugged exits.
Waits for and then attaches to the next COBOL program which calls CBL_DEBUG_START with the identifier you specify in the ID field as an argument.
Waits for and then attaches to the next COBOL program that calls CBL_DEBUGBREAK, or is launched with the COBSW environment variable set to +A. (Windows only).
debug.cobol.native.properties.useConsole: Use a console for screen input/output.
debug.cobol.native.properties.processNam: The process name to attach to. If this is used, 'processId' should not be used.
The process id to attach to. If 'processId' used, 'processName' should not be used.
debug.cobol.native.properties.symbolsMus: Require program symbols (.idy) to exactly match the program.
debug.cobol.native.snippets.launch.descr: A new configuration for debugging a native COBOL application.
debug.cobol.native.snippets.launchRemote: A new configuration for remotely debugging a native COBOL application.
A new configuration for debugging a native COBOL application using Remote Development.
A new configuration for debugging a native 64-bit COBOL application.
debug.cobol.native.snippets.attach.descr: Attach the native COBOL debugger to a running process.
debug.cobol.native.snippets.launchES.des: A new configuration for debugging an Enterprise Server application.
debug.cobol.native.snippets.waitForAttac: A new configuration to wait for attachment to a running native COBOL program.
debug.cobol.native.snippets.debugCurrent: A new configuration for debugging the current program.
viewsWelcome.explorer.content:
In order to use Micro Focus COBOL, you can [open a folder](command:vscode.openFolder) containing a COBOL program or create a new program.
[Create COBOL program](command:mfcobol.newCobolProgram)
viewsWelcome.debug.content: To learn more about debugging COBOL code, see [Debugging COBOL](https://www.microfocus.com/documentation/vscode/cobol/GUID-F2BE48DA-75A9-46D5-9B18-54A4185E8781.html).
commands.notebook.setTarget.title: Cell type for run/debug
commands.notebook.addDirective.title: Add directive
commands.notebook.deleteDirectives.title: Select directive(s) to delete
commands.registerInJdtLs.title: Register COBOL JVM support in Java Language Server (JDT LS)
commands.unregisterInJdtLs.title: Unregister COBOL JVM support in Java Language Server (JDT LS)
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.projec: The preferred project in which the debugger searches for classes. There could be duplicated class names in different projects. This setting also works when the debugger looks for the specified main class when launching a program. It is required for expression evaluation.
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.mainCl: The fully qualified class name (e.g. [module name/]com.xyz.MainApp) or the file path of the COBOL JVM program.
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.args.d: The command line arguments passed to the program.
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.vmArgs: The extra options and system properties for the JVM (e.g. -Xms<size> -Xmx<size> -D<name>=<value>).
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.module: The modulepaths for launching the JVM. If not specified, the debugger will automatically resolve from current project.
Automatically resolve the module paths of current project.
The module paths within 'runtime' scope of current project.
The module paths within 'test' scope of current project.
The path after '!' will be excluded from the modulePaths.
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.classP: The classpaths for launching the JVM. If not specified, the debugger will automatically resolve from current project.
Automatically resolve the classpaths of current project.
The classpaths within 'runtime' scope of current project.
The classpaths within 'test' scope of current project.
The path after '!' will be excluded from the classpaths.
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.source: The extra source directories of the program. The debugger looks for source code from project settings by default. This option allows the debugger to look for source code in extra directories.
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.cwd.de: The working directory of the program. Defaults to the current workspace root.
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.env.de: The extra environment variables for the program.
debug.cobol.jvm.properties.launch.stopOn: Automatically pause the program after launching.
debug.cobol.jvm.snippet.launch.descripti: Add a new configuration for launching a COBOL JVM program.
debug.cobol.jvm.snippet.launchCurrentFil: Add a new configuration for launching current COBOL JVM file.
debug.cobol.jvm.snippet.launchWithArgume: Add a new configuration for launching a COBOL JVM program with arguments prompt.
